description: System-generated unique identifier for the equipment record.
System timestamp of the most recent change to this record; likely yyyymmddhhmmssfff format; confirm with SME.
Indicates whether the asset is inactive/retired and no longer in service.
Indicates the vehicle is equipped with a rooftop light bar.
Indicates the vehicle has no external light bar (slick-top).
Indicates LoJack or similar theft-recovery device is installed.
Flags assets purchased using grant funding.
Marks the record as confidential for restricted visibility.
Indicates the asset is subject to an active manufacturer recall.
Date the asset was disposed of/removed from ownership.
Date the asset was retired from active service.
Date the disposal transaction was processed or posted; clarify difference from disposaldate with SME.
Date the asset was placed into service.
Date the asset was purchased.
Start/effective date for meter 2 estimation settings; likely configuration metadata; confirm with SME.
Start/effective date for primary meter estimation settings; likely configuration metadata; confirm with SME.
Last update date for meter 2 estimation/configuration settings; confirm with SME.
Last update date for primary meter estimation/configuration settings; confirm with SME.
Purchase order identifier associated with acquiring the asset.
Engine displacement or series designation for the asset’s engine.
Oil filter part number or specification for the asset.
Primary tire size specification for the asset.
Vehicle license plate number.
Vehicle Identification Number or serial identifier for the asset.
Number of engine cylinders; 0 indicates not applicable or non-combustion power.
Model or manufacture year of the asset.
Internal equipment or asset number assigned by the agency.
Retirement/disposal notes, including sale details or disposition remarks.
General notes or additional remarks about the asset.
Configured expected or threshold reading for meter 2; used for planning/alerts; confirm with SME.
Configured expected or threshold reading for the primary meter; used for planning/alerts; confirm with SME.
Sale proceeds received when the asset was disposed.
Accumulated depreciation recorded for the asset.
Current monthly depreciation amount for the asset.
Estimated salvage value used for depreciation or replacement planning.
Historical/legacy recorded acquisition cost; may differ from capitalized cost; confirm with SME.
Depreciation life or planned service life (periods/years as configured); confirm units with SME.
Down payment amount paid at acquisition.
Meter 2 reading at time of purchase or commissioning.
Primary meter reading at time of purchase or commissioning.
Purchase price paid for the asset (excluding later upfit).
Cumulative fuel consumed by the asset to date; units per system configuration.
Primary fuel tank capacity.
Expected lifetime usage for meter 2 used for lifecycle planning; confirm with SME.
Life-to-date accumulated reading for meter 2.
Forecasted current reading for meter 2 based on estimation rules.
Configured usage rate or distance basis for meter 2 forecasts; confirm with SME.
Current reading of meter 2 (secondary meter).
Expected lifetime usage for the primary meter used for lifecycle planning; confirm with SME.
Life-to-date accumulated reading for the primary meter.
Forecasted current reading for the primary meter based on estimation rules.
Configured usage rate or distance basis for primary meter forecasts; confirm with SME.
Current reading of the primary meter (e.g., odometer or hours).
Gross Vehicle Weight Rating (maximum allowable weight).
Actual curb or empty vehicle weight; confirm precise definition with SME.
Asset age in years, typically calculated from model year or in-service date.
Vehicle title number or status; confirm usage with SME.
Vendor identifier used for purchase; legacy or alternate to purvendor; confirm with SME.
Lookup/display value for buyvendor.
Purchase type code (e.g., new, lease, surplus); organization-defined.
Lookup/display value for purtype.
Vendor identifier associated with the asset purchase.
Lookup/display value for purvendor.
Primary fuel type code (e.g., gasoline, diesel, electric).
Lookup/display value for fueltype.
Condition code describing current asset condition.
Lookup/display value for condition.
Equipment subtype classification code.
Lookup/display value for eqsubtype.
Equipment type classification code.
Lookup/display value for equiptype.
Color code for the asset’s exterior finish.
Lookup/display value for color.
Operational status code (e.g., active, pending disposal, disposed).
Lookup/display value for equipstatus.
Equipment model code referencing model master.
Lookup/display value for model (eqmodel).
Equipment manufacturer/make code.
Lookup/display value for make (eqmake).
Indicates sub-equipment status or child relationship to a parent asset; confirm coding with SME.
Organizational or cost hierarchy level 9 code for assignment/ownership.
Lookup/display value for hierlvl9.
Top-level organizational or cost hierarchy code for assignment/ownership.
Lookup/display value for hierlvl1.
Identifier of the employee, unit, or department currently assigned the asset.
Lookup/display value for assigned (employee).
Method used to estimate meter 2 usage (e.g., moving average).
Unit type for meter 2 (e.g., hours, miles, none).
Method used to estimate primary meter usage (e.g., moving average).
Unit type for the primary meter (e.g., miles, hours).
Primary image of the asset stored as binary data.
Unique identifier for the asset in a legacy system.
Legacy source table name for migrated asset data.
Engine serial number; confirm usage with SME.
Engine power rating (horsepower); confirm units with SME.
Engine calibration/control identifier; confirm meaning with SME.
Engine model designation.
Engine manufacturer.
Engine code or internal designation; confirm with SME.
Transmission serial number.
Transmission model designation.
Transmission manufacturer.
Transmission type (e.g., automatic, manual, CVT).
Rated capacity in tons; often for trucks or equipment; confirm rating basis.
Wheelbase length; confirm units.
Recommended front tire pressure.
Wheel/rim size specification.
Retread/recap tire status or policy indicator; confirm coding with SME.
Rear/back tire size specification.
Front tire size specification.
Additional specification field for user-defined details.
Additional specification field for user-defined details.
Additional specification field for user-defined details.
User-defined section/department classification code.
User-defined section/department classification code.
User-defined section/department classification code.
User-defined section/department classification code.
User-defined section/department classification code.
User-defined section/department classification code.
User-defined section/department classification code.
User-defined section/department classification code.
Physical address or garaging location for the asset.
Additional serial number for a component/attachment.
Additional serial number for a component/attachment.
Primary serial number for the asset (if not a VIN).
Human-readable description of the asset combining number, year, make, and model.
Number of rear tires or wheels; confirm exact interpretation with SME.
Maintenance cost as a percentage of capital or replacement cost; confirm denominator with SME.
Total maintenance expenditures to date for the asset.
Recurring payment amount, typically for lease or loan obligations.
Lease term length, usually in months.
Configured expected or threshold reading for meter 4; used for planning/alerts; confirm with SME.
Configured expected or threshold reading for meter 3; used for planning/alerts; confirm with SME.
User-entered estimated current value of the asset.
System-calculated current value (e.g., depreciated value).
Periodic principal and interest payment for asset financing.
Loan down payment amount at inception.
Down payment percentage applied at loan start.
Loan term length, typically in months.
Loan interest rate.
Calculated salvage value amount used in financial schedules.
Salvage factor/percentage applied to determine salvage value.
Capitalized cost basis for the asset, including purchase and applicable capital additions.
Cost of aftermarket equipment, upfitting, or modifications.
Meter 4 reading at time of purchase or commissioning.
Meter 3 reading at time of purchase or commissioning.
Secondary tank capacity (e.g., DEF, auxiliary fuel).
Tertiary tank capacity for additional fluids or fuels.
Life-to-date accumulated reading for meter 4.
Life-to-date accumulated reading for meter 3.
Forecasted current reading for meter 4 based on estimation rules.
Forecasted current reading for meter 3 based on estimation rules.
Current reading of meter 4.
Current reading of meter 3.
Expected lifetime usage for meter 4 used for lifecycle planning; confirm with SME.
Expected lifetime usage for meter 3 used for lifecycle planning; confirm with SME.
Configured usage rate or distance basis for meter 4 forecasts; confirm with SME.
Configured usage rate or distance basis for meter 3 forecasts; confirm with SME.
Warranty duration value for the asset.
Inflation rate used for projecting future replacement costs.
Projected escrow balance or target for asset replacement funding.
Projected replacement cost for the asset.
Planned lifecycle length (years or periods) for replacement planning; confirm units with SME.
Priority score or ranking for replacement or attention.
Primary oil/fluid capacity; confirm fluid type and units with SME.
Secondary oil/fluid capacity; confirm fluid type and units with SME.
Tertiary oil/fluid capacity; confirm fluid type and units with SME.
Longitude coordinate of the asset’s physical location.
Latitude coordinate of the asset’s physical location.
Total cost associated with linked child/sub assets.
Total cost of work orders associated with the asset.
Combined costs of the asset and its related child assets.
Indicates the asset uses an individual preventive maintenance schedule.
System flag controlling whether the asset’s category can be edited by users.
Indicates a high-usage/meter alert email has been sent for this asset.
Indicates the asset is financed via a loan.
Indicates meter 4 is linked to a master meter for roll-up or synchronization.
Indicates meter 3 is linked to a master meter for roll-up or synchronization.
Indicates meter 2 is linked to a master meter for roll-up or synchronization.
Indicates the primary meter is linked to a master meter for roll-up or synchronization.
Indicates a user manually updated meter values (as opposed to automated feeds).
Indicates warranty information exists for this asset.
Controls whether the system calculates replacement escrow for this asset.
Controls whether status changes are logged to a history table.
Indicates the record represents a tool rather than a vehicle/rolling stock.
Indicates the tool is available for assignment or checkout.
Lease end date.
Lease start date.
Start/effective date for meter 4 estimation settings; confirm with SME.
Start/effective date for meter 3 estimation settings; confirm with SME.
Last update date for meter 4 estimation/configuration settings; confirm with SME.
Last update date for meter 3 estimation/configuration settings; confirm with SME.
Warranty expiration date.
Generic expiration date (e.g., registration or inspection); confirm exact use with SME.
Manufacture/build date of the asset.
Replacement date or reported date; meaning unclear; confirm with SME.
Preventive maintenance class or program code.
Lookup/display value for pm_class.
Code explaining why the asset was made inactive.
Lookup/display value for inactivereason.
Grant funding source or category code.
Lookup/display value for grant_fund.
Identifier of the lessee or receiving department/entity.
Lookup/display value for leasedto.
Required operator certifications or credentials code.
Lookup/display value for req_cert.
Seasonal activity code indicating when the asset is in operation.
Lookup/display value for active_season.
Projected year for asset replacement (often fiscal year).
Lookup/display or formatted value for proj_repl_year.
Service type code describing operational category (e.g., police, public works).
Lookup/display value for service_type.
Service class code for finer categorization within service type.
Lookup/display value for service_class.
Engine specification identifier or rating (e.g., horsepower); data suggests numeric value; confirm units with SME.
Lookup/display value for engine (asset_engine).
Issuing state/province code for the license plate.
Lookup/display value for licplst.
Organizational or cost hierarchy level 2 code for assignment/ownership.
Lookup/display value for hierlvl2.
Oil specification/type code for maintenance.
Lookup/display value for oiltype.
User-defined category/subcategory code; clarify local meaning with SME.
Lookup/display value for otsub3.
User-defined category code; clarify local meaning with SME.
Lookup/display value for ot3.
User-defined category/subcategory code; clarify local meaning with SME.
Lookup/display value for otsub2.
User-defined category code; clarify local meaning with SME.
Lookup/display value for ot2.
User-defined category/subcategory code; clarify local meaning with SME.
Lookup/display value for otsub1.
User-defined category code; clarify local meaning with SME.
Lookup/display value for ot1.
Secondary oil specification/type code for maintenance.
Lookup/display value for oil2.
Primary oil specification/type code for maintenance.
Lookup/display value for oil1.
Secondary fuel type code for multi-fuel assets.
Lookup/display value for fuel2.
Primary fuel type code (alternate coding to fueltype); confirm with SME.
Lookup/display value for fuel1.
Location code (level 4) for asset storage or assignment.
Lookup/display value for loc4.
Location code (level 3) for asset storage or assignment.
Lookup/display value for loc3.
Location code (level 2) for asset storage or assignment.
Lookup/display value for loc2.
Location code (level 1) for asset storage or assignment.
Lookup/display value for loc1.
Inspection setup or template code required for the asset.
Lookup/display value for setup_inspection.
Asset type code (e.g., vehicle, equipment).
Lookup/display value for assettype.
Basis for salvage value (e.g., dollar or percent).
Method used to estimate meter 4 usage.
Method used to estimate meter 3 usage.
Unit type for meter 4 (e.g., hours, miles, none).
Unit type for meter 3 (e.g., hours, miles, none).
Trigger for warranty start (e.g., purchase or in-service date).
Time unit for warranty duration (e.g., days, months).
Format/type for physical location data (e.g., coordinates).
External map link or identifier for asset location; confirm with SME.
Timestamp of a recorded repair event used for analytics/metrics.
Timestamp used to anchor maintenance cost calculations or reporting windows.
Preventive maintenance template identifier applied to this asset.
Lookup/display value for asset_pmtemplate.
User-entered projected replacement cost value.
Flag indicating the system should use user_projrepcost instead of calculated projections.
Override for lifecycle timing; values may represent a specific year or offset; confirm rules with SME.
Recommended rear tire pressure.
Planned date for asset replacement.
Flag indicating planned replacement date is manually overridden/locked.
Identifier for the responsible contact person for the asset.
Lookup/display value for asset_contact.
Calculated average daily usage for meter 4.
Calculated average daily usage for meter 3.
Calculated average daily usage for meter 2.
Calculated average daily usage for the primary meter.
VIN validation or decoding error details; empty when none.
Indicates whether the VIN was successfully decoded into make/model attributes.
Electronic toll transponder identifier assigned to the vehicle.
Count of repair events in the past 12 months.
Total maintenance costs incurred in the past 12 months.
Cumulative lifetime fuel cost for the asset.
Cumulative lifetime preventative maintenance cost for the asset.
Repair costs as a percentage of capital or purchase cost.
Cumulative lifetime repair cost for the asset.
Annual escalation rate or factor applied to projected replacement cost; confirm basis with SME.
Date the asset was received by the agency or entered into inventory.
